dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4236 IH: 1890s Advancing and Building Leadership and Excellence Opportunity Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Adams (for herself, Ms. Strickland, and Mr. Bishop of Georgia) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 to modify the areas of focus for centers of excellence at 1890 Institutions, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the 1890s Advancing and Building Leadership and Excellence Opportunity Act of 2023.
Section 1673(d) of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 5926(d)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting but not more than 10 after not less than 3;
in paragraph (2), by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: A center of excellence established under paragraph (1) may focus on climate change adaption and mitigation, soil health and carbon sequestration, nutrient and manure management, advanced grazing management and crop-livestock integration, perennial production systems, agroforestry, on-farm and food system energy efficiency and renewable energy production, and food waste reduction.

A center of excellence established under paragraph (1) may focus on fostering forest conservation, agroforestry, enhancing forest resilience to climate change, and urban and community forestry programs to promote biodiversity and environmental health.

subparagraph.header: Food safety, bioprocessing, and value-added agriculture
subparagraph.text: A center of excellence established under paragraph (1) may focus on food safety, bioprocessing, value-added agriculture enterprise development, and innovative food and agriculture product development.

subparagraph.header: Food and agricultural sciences and the social sciences
subparagraph.text: A center of excellence established under paragraph (1) may focus on the integration of the social sciences, including economics, psychology, rural sociology, and other social sciences and data sciences, into the food and agricultural sciences to develop comprehensive solutions to issues impacting underserved farmers and communities.

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3), by striking $10,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023 and inserting $50,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2024 through 2028.
